content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: The figure presents a single measure on a staff in Bass clef. There is no key signature or time signature. A chord of two whole notes is shown with pitches D 3 and G 3.
The figure presents a single measure on a staff in Bass clef. There is no key signature or time signature. A chord of two whole notes is shown with pitches D 3 and G sharp 3.
The figure presents a single measure on a staff in Bass clef. There is no key signature or time signature. A chord of two whole notes is shown with pitches D 3 and A 3.
The figure presents a single measure on a staff in Bass clef. There is no key signature or time signature. A chord of two whole notes is shown with pitches D 3 and A sharp 3.

content.answer: The figure presents a single measure on a staff in Bass clef. There is no key signature or time signature. A chord of two whole notes is shown with pitches D 3 and A 3.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
